text: Klaus Ferdinand Hasselmann (born 25 October 1931) is a German oceanographer and climate modeller. He is Professor Emeritus at the University of Hamburg and former Director of the Max Planck Institute for Meteorology. He was awarded the 2021 Nobel Prize in Physics with Syukuro Manabe and Giorgio Parisi. He is best known for creating the Hasselmann model. His works has helped track and model the effects and weather patterns of climate change. He was elected a member of the Academia Europaea in 1988. ==Referemces== Category:1931 births Category:Living people Category:German scientists Category:Oceanographers Category:German academics Category:Writers from Hamburg Category:Members of Academia Europaea
